author: Colin Bowles
title: CONCORD WINS BIG
text:
CONCORD WINS BIG - WVVA TV Bluefield Beckley WV News, Weather and Sports Member Center: Follow @ColinxBowles ATHENS, WV - 
The Concord Mountain Lions achieved an easy victory today against UVa-Wise, 63-21, their seventh straight homecoming win. The Mountain Lions scored a touchdown less than 2 minutes in the first quarter, and the points didn't stop there. Head Coach Garin Justice credited his offense for the stress-free victory. 
Calvinaugh Jones led the team with three touchdowns and 260 rushing yards, a career high. Along with the points from Jones, Jamal Petty, TJ Smith, Jermeil Douse, and Justin Cogar all added touchdowns for the Mountain Lions. Quarterback Brian Novak was 15-for-23 with 221 yards and two touchdowns. 
The UVa-Wise Cavaliers had a weak offense throughout the game with several incomplete passes and two safeties. The CU defense held the Cavaliers to negative nine rushing yards. 
Saturday's win comes after a tough loss against Charleston last Thursday. The Mountain Lions are now 4-2, and will face Notre Dame on Saturday. The Concord Mountain Lions achieved an easy victory today against UVa-Wise, their seventh straight homecoming win.
